div.dateline:
[Right Side]
Fort Des Moines Iowa
Monday 6.15 pm.
div.p:
[Left Side]
make it stamps. Then
back to barracks. Then
ate dinner at 1.30. Then
to infirmary at 2. Oh! me!
Oh! my! Same thing all
over again and three
shots on top of that. My
left arm is a little sore.
[But] guess I'll live. Will
[?] you again but wait
until I send you an address
tell all the gang. How are
my babies. I know I'll
miss them. I bunked with
Mary Walker last night. We
had a lot of fun. We were
the only ones with a lower
birth (sic). Love to All Mother

at 9 am. Then w[ ] issued Soldiers
overcoats & caps to keep us warm. Some [galoshes?]
3 bath towels as big as sheets 3 hankerchiefs
tooth brush & comb. Then went to ware house
for clothes. This is what I got.
5 blouses 2 pr. anklets
1 coat } 1 pr. sneakers
1 skirt } uniform 2 pr. oxfords
1 overcoat 2 pr. flannelette pajamas
1 raincoat 1 corduroy robe
2 pr. shoes 2 fatigue suits
4 pr. cotton stockings 3 rayon jersey slips
4 " rayon " 4 pr " " pants
2 girdles 1 cap 1 tobaggan cap
3 brassiers. I think this is all and I
sure could kick some one's but for having
us bring all these things. Show this list
to Peggy & Mildred. I didn't have to
have an alteration Perfect 16 long.
You can't write to me this week as
we are going to another co. Sat. If
you want to send [?] anything

Ann Smith
Co. 23. Reg 3
Barracks 80
Fort Des Moines Iowa

Mr. and Mrs. G.W. Carlstead
1102 Dillon Drive
St. Louis
Mo.

that was taken the first day we were here. We had on enlisted men's coats on the way to the warehouse for uniforms. Please send full instructions as to how to use your camera. We don't seem to be able to get it focused right. So I haven't used the second roll of films. Well this week tells the story whether I get to come home and what I will be doing. We are all getting curious. I am still holding out for Motor Corps.

I talked to Peggy and Mildred the other night. I guess you have seen them and they told you if anything serious should happen at home and you would want me call Red Cross Headquarters there and tell them the situation and request emergency furlough. Also have the Dr. call them.

opener.dateline:
Women's Army Auxiliary Corps
For Des Moines, Iowa

div.p:
For Des Moines, IA
Monday Noon
Dear Kids,

Received box yesterday and did I ever appreciate it. Those dates were really good. I was on special detail yesterday. Officers mess. They are trying to convert me into being a cook and I won't be converted for that is not what I want. It is a shame the way they waste food. Gallons of coffee, great chunks of butter and every thing else throwed out. For dinner yesterday: carrot sticks, soup, stuffed celery, roast duck and dressing, potatoes, asparagus, aspic salad, hot rolls and butter, coffee, milk, fresh strawberry shortcacke with ice cream.
a college graduate.

Tues noon. Just finished eadting dinner.
2pm. Just set down and was called out on the double to report to supply room for scarf. Now I am in class and just heard that we would be free from next Wed until Mon. So I would like to come home so if you want me send me some money this weekend so I can ask for my pass as soon as possible. I understand your own basic training will be finished then and we will know what corps we will be in and what we are going to do. I feel like a school kid going to school so much.
I have started and stopped so much since I started to write this letter. I don't know what I am doing. You have never sent me Al's address.
Supper - Every kind of cold meat: ham, beef, pork, salami, etc; cheese; sliced tomatoes; olives; celery; carrot sticks; potato salad; cottage cheese; all kinds of cookies and ice cream.

Tues morn. Another line or two. The whole Co. had a party int he day room last night. They are picking 10 from each platoon and then they will be eliminated down to 10 from the Co for OCS this week. I can't make it for you have to have a high school education. I understand it is the first time that they have taken girls right from basic.
How are the boys and G.W.? Take good care of them.
Is it very cold there? Seems as
Has he been down lately? What did he have to say? Peggy has never wrote to me and Mildred owes me a letter.
Well guess I had better ring off for this time. Write often.

Love,
Mother
The fare will be $8.50 and I won't get Pullman's for we can't get rates if we do. It doesn't hurt me to set up and sleep.
M.

Women's Army Auxiliary Corps
For Des Moines, Iowa

tho it can't get above zero. It
was 23 below zero yesterday a.m.
Are you working? If you see Norma,
tell her I am still waiting for an
answer to my card. Had a nice
letter from Jill. Also one from
Mrs. [Stella?]. She said she was
going to send me some candy.
Emma Smith treated me to a
supper in Des Moines Sat. night.
She must have plenty of money. $1.85
a [piece?] for a steak. She was the
one that had the twin sister that
took the examination & then backed
out. Her sister & sweetheart are coming
up Sat.
My girl friend from Miss. got
sent to Bakers & Cooks Sat. She is

Aux. Ann Smith
Co. 2. Reg. 3
First WAAC Training Center
Fort Des Moines. Iowa

Mrs. G. W. Carlstead
1102 Dillon Dr.
St. Louis
Mo.
